10.1109/ACCESS.2023.3326429.title: Contextualization of a Radical Language Detection System Through Moral Values and Emotions
10.1109/ACCESS.2023.3326429.author: Real, Patricia Alonso Del and Araque, Oscar
10.1109/ACCESS.2023.3326429.paperMotivationText: The popularity of current communication technologies has boosted the spread of polarization and radical ideologies, which can be exploited by terrorist organizations. Automatic radicalization detection in text is thus an important task.
10.1109/ACCESS.2023.3326429.paperContributionText: This work focuses on the task of automatic radicalization detection in texts. The authors investigate the effectiveness of integrating moral values through MFT.
10.1109/ACCESS.2023.3326429.paperResultsText: Experimental results indicate that assessing moral values in text is helpful for radicalization detection in text.
10.1109/ACCESS.2023.3326429.resourcesOtherText: pro- vs. anti-ISIS tweets (Rowe and Saif 2021), Radicalization in magazines (Araque and Iglesias 2020), Jacobs cyber-recruitement dataset (Scanlon and Gerber 2014), NRC Hashtag Emotion Lexicon (Mohammad and Kiritchenko 2015)
